full_text: BES ce Hise Be ait Tere 2024/KER/4888 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MRS. JUSTICE SOPHY THOMAS MONDAY, THE 22 DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 2ND MAGHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 16 OF 2024 CRIME NO.1490/2023 OF Kannur Town, Kannur PETITIONERS /ACCUSED NOS.1 TO 3: 1 SHAMEEM P.V AGED 36 YEARS S/O MUHAMMED.N, 'AL DURRA', CHERUKUNNU P.O, KANNUR DIST, PIN - 670301 2 MUHAMMED .N AGED 60 YEARS ' Al DURRA' CHERUKUNNU P.O, KANNUR DIST-, PIN - 670301 3 SAINABA AGED 52 YEARS W/O MUHAMMED.N, ' AL DURRA', CHERUKUNNU P.O, KANNUR DIST, PIN - 670301 BY ADV P.K.MOHAMED JAMEEL RESPONDENTS /COMPLAINANTS : 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, PIN - 682031 2 JUMANA HASEEN AGED 26 YEARS D/O A.C ABDUL KHADER, "SUJOOD MANZIL", MAMMAKUNNU ROAD, KADACHIRA P.O, KANNUR DIST, PIN - 670621 SR.PP-SRI.VIPIN NARAYAN THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASK HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 22.01.2024, THER COURT ON THE SAMBR DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: = Daan 2024/KER/4888 CRL.MC NO.16 OF 2024 2 ORDER Dated this the 22"! day of January , 2024 This Crl.M.C., under Section 482 of CrP.C., is filed by accused Nos.1 to 3 in Crime No.1490 of 2023 of Kannur Town Police Station, Kannur, registered under Section 498A r/w Section 34 of IPC, for quashing Annexure Ai FIR. 2. The prosecution allegation is that, accused Nos.1 to 3, who are the husband and in-laws of the defacto complainant/2 respondent, subjected her to matrimonial cruelties, demanding more gold and money. 3. When the matter is taken up for consideration, learned counsel for the petitioners submitted that the matter stands settled between themselves and the defacto complainant/2 respondent. The defacto complainant entered appearance through counsel, and submitted that the matter is settled, and Annexure A2 is the affidavit filed by her, endorsing the settlement. She has no intention to Daan 2024/KER/4888 CRL.MC NO.16 OF 2024 proceed with the prosecution. She has no objection in quashing the proceedings pending against the petitioners pursuant to Crime No.1490 of 2023 of Kannur Town Police Station. 4. On instructions, learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the matter is settled, and he produced signed statement of the 2 respondent, to the effect that she is not intending to proceed with the prosecution, and she has no objection in quashing Annexure Ai FIR in Crime No.1490 of 2023 of Kannur Town Police Station. 5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioners. 6. In the light of the principles laid down by the Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another; [(2012) 10 SCC 303) ], and State of Madhya Pradesh v. Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court is of the view that the proceedings against the ea tal Reon es cape sat Tere 2024/KER/4888 CRL.MC NO.16 OF 2024 4 petitioners can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Moreover, the dispute is purely personal in nature, and no public interest is involved in it. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure Al FIR in Crime No.1490 of 2023 of Kannur Town Police Station, stands quashed. Sd/- SOPHY THOMAS JUDGE SSK/22/01 obra ce Hise Ee ake Tere 2024/KER/4888 CRL.MC NO.16 OF 2024 5 APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 16/2024 PETITIONER ANNEXURES Annexure Al THE COPY OF THE F.I.R IN CRIME NO:1490/2023 OF KANNUR TOWN POLICE STATION Annexure A2 THE ORIGINAL AFFIDAVIT SWORN IN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT
